DOC.brief_summary: This study is designed to develop a clinical registry of Peripheral Arterial Disease (PAD) patients undergoing lower extremity revascularization to describe the population and assess comparative effectiveness of endovascular therapy versus surgery. In addition, this study will conduct a prospective cohort study of patients treated medically or undergoing lower extremity revascularization at the VA and Kaiser Colorado to compare changes in health status.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness of Medical Therapy, Endovascular Therapy, and Surgery for Peripheral Arterial Disease
DOC.detailed_description: Using electronic medical records, a registry of patients undergoing lower extremity revascularization therapy will be identified. Chart reviews with be done by an expert panel. The prospective cohort study will ask participants to complete health status surveys before they begin therapy for PAD and again 6 months later.
DOC.criteria: presents with PAD, > 18 years of age, can complete a questionnaire, and has either had a change in PAD lower extremity intervention or start of a new intervention (surgical, endovascular, or medical therapy (cilostazol or exercise regimen) dementia, inability to consent, pregnancy, limited life expectancy (< 6 months), previous endovascular or surgical revascularization within the previous 12 months, non English speaking
